    • Method Detail

      • getCommand

        protected byte[] getCommand(byte aAddress)
        For commands, this returns the sequence of bytes to send in the command.
        Parameters:
        aAddress - The packet-serial address. For USB devices, this should just be 0x80.
        Returns:
        The sequence of bytes to send.

      • getResponseLength

        protected int getResponseLength()
        For commands which need to read a fixed length response, this method should return the number of bytes expected.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes expected to be read as a response from this command.

      • onResponse

        protected void onResponse(byte[] aResponseBuffer,
              int aResponseLength)
        This method handles the response from the command and delegates any side-effects of the response to the appropriate handler.
        Parameters:
        aResponseBuffer - The response from the motor controller to this command.
        aResponseLength - The length of the buffer which has been filled with a response.

      • getReadMode

        protected int getReadMode()

      • calculateChecksum

        protected byte calculateChecksum(byte[] aBytes)
        This method returns the checksum calculated for the given byte array.
        Parameters:
        aBytes - A byte array containing bytes for which the checksum should be calculated.
        Returns:
        The checksum which would appear in the final byte of the array.

      • calculateChecksum

        protected byte calculateChecksum(byte[] aBytes,
                     int aLength)
